content:
Check:
  any:
    - all:
        - name: --STINT
          operator: empty
        - name: --ENINT
          operator: non_empty
    - all:
        - name: --ENINT
          operator: empty
        - name: --STINT
          operator: non_empty
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.295
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: WHEN --STINT ^= null OR --ENINT ^= null THEN --STINT ^= null  AND --ENINT
  ^= null
Outcome:
  Message: --STINT and --ENINT must both be populated or none of them must be populated
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '295'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Time points with collections over a duration also
                  typically include the --STINT and --ENINT variables, which specify
                  the start and end of the period over which the assessment was evaluated,
                  based on the --TPTREF anchor.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: 4.4.7.2.3
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: WHEN --STINT ^= null OR --ENINT ^= null THEN --STINT ^= null  AND --ENINT ^= null

Outcome.Message: --STINT and --ENINT must both be populated or none of them must be populated

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Time points with collections over a duration also typically include the --STINT and --ENINT variables, which specify the start and end of the period over which the assessment was evaluated, based on the --TPTREF anchor.
